result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristy L Wiedenhoeft was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescribed.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet previously done.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Hearing on August 10, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Case called at 10:58 am.  Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Kristy L Wiedenhoeft did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the nonappearance of the defendant.  Attorney Weathers makes statements requesting this case be set over until Monday to try to reach her client.  Court revokes/forfeits bail, orders a capais, stayed until the set hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kristy L Wiedenhoeft in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is awaiting an amended offer from the State as the defendant has completed her DPA with Milwaukee County.  Court will set this matter for trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kristy L Wiedenhoeft in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is awaiting a pretrial offer in this matter.  Defendant has completed her DPA in Milwaukee County and expects to be discharged shortly.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Kristy L Wiedenhoeft did not appear.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Hearing on April 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kristy L Wiedenhoeft in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests further proceedings date.  State provides discovery and complaint.  Hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on February 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with any victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Follow thru the the Justice Point program in Milwaukee County.

Defendant Kristy L Wiedenhoeft in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
